answers.author: Israel Murguia
answers.text:
The following link provides information of municipalities in the state of Washington that have established park/rec districts: http://srch.mrsc.org/search?q=park%20recreation%20district&btnG=Search&spell=1&client=mrscsite_frontend&output=xml_no_dtd&proxystylesheet=mrscsite_frontend&sort=date%3AD%3AL%3Ad1&entqr=3&oe=UTF-8&ie=UTF-8&ud=1&site=default_collection&filter=0&ip=72.200.94.123&access=p
For the first link, see Whatcom County & Chelan County for sample interlocal agreements. Also see link 5 (Intergovernmental Cooperation in Parks and Recreation) which has sample documents regarding intergovernmental cooperation, general statements of cooperation, consolidated administration, acquisition/development of facilities, use of facilities and programs. I hope this helps.

answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I have found some areas that have created joint parks and recreation districts. 
In Ohio the city of Marysville, the Board of Trustees of Paris Township, and the Board of County Commissioners of Union County, joined together to create the Union County Joint Recreation District. The link to their homepage is below.
http://www.ucjrd.com/
Also, in Ohio the Centerburg Joint Recreation District (CJRD) was created by an agreement between the jurisdictions of Centerburg, Hilliar, Liberty, and Milford. 
http://www.cjrd.org/parks-facilities.htm
The Pewaukee Park and Recreation Department was established as a Joint Department which services the city and the village of Pewaukee, Wisconsin.
http://www.cityofpewaukee.us/park-and-recreation.php
The Municipal Research and Services Center of Washington has a list of the different types of joint Parks and Recreation Departments in Washington state.
http://www.mrsc.org/Subjects/Parks/prdistricts.aspx
In Montana, the Madison Valley residents, the Madison County Commissioners and representatives from the Big Sky community are in the process of considering a similar agreement. You can see more information about their process below. 
http://www.madisoniannews.com/2011/07/groups-get-closer-to-agreement-on-big-sky-parks-district-boundary/
I also found an example of  legal language used to create a joint parks and recreation agreement.
http://codes.ohio.gov/orc/755.14
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org
